words.description: A person who takes action to support a political or social cause.
A person who acts as an assistant to an important person.
A disease caused by HIV that weakens the immune system.
A vehicle that can fly, such as an airplane or helicopter.
A company that provides regular flights for passengers or cargo.
A place where aircraft regularly take off and land.
Used to refer to something that used to happen but no longer does.
Knowledge or perception of a situation or fact.
Used to emphasize the most important reason or fact about something.
A sport where teams of five players try to score by putting a ball through a hoop.
The ball used in the sport of basketball.
A room containing a toilet and typically also a sink and a shower or bathtub.
An attack using bombs.
A male partner in a romantic relationship.
Chief Executive Officer, the highest-ranking person in a company.
A type of fat found in your blood that is necessary in small amounts.
A room where teaching or learning takes place.
A person who provides expert advice professionally.
The extent to which something is covered, such as in insurance or news reporting.
To express disapproval of someone or something.
The molecule that carries genetic instructions in living things.
The central part of a city.
Toward or in the central part of a city.
Relating to devices, systems, or circuits that operate using the flow of electrons (electric current), such as computers or TVs.
A system for sending written messages electronically from one computer or device to another.
To send a message electronically via email.
Relating to the natural world and the impact of human activity on its condition.
Used to emphasize the basic or fundamental nature of something; basically or fundamentally.
Short for 'et cetera', meaning 'and other similar things' or 'and so on'.
A smaller number of; used with countable nouns.
A building or indoor area for parking or storing vehicles.
A place where vehicles are repaired and maintained.
A unit of heredity that is transferred from a parent to offspring and determines some characteristic of the offspring.
A woman or girl who someone is dating or in a romantic relationship with.
Relating to or encompassing the entire world.
Of the most outstanding or highest rank, quality, or degree.
A general rule, principle, or piece of advice.
A type of aircraft that derives lift and propulsion from one or more sets of horizontally revolving overhead rotors.
A friendly greeting or way to say hello.
An outstanding part of an event or period of time.
To emphasize or make something stand out.
Stands for 'id est' in Latin, meaning 'that is to say' or 'in other words'.
A global computer network providing a variety of information and communication facilities.
Relating to Iraq or its people.
Relating to Islam, its teachings, or its culture.
Relating to Israel or its people.
The way in which a person or group lives, including habits, attitudes, and values.
Extending over or involving a relatively long period of time.
A large number or amount of something.
Cosmetics such as lipstick or powder applied to the face.
The combination of qualities that form a person's character or an object's structure.
A vocal sound expressing agreement or confirmation.
Informal term for mother.
The reason or reasons one has for acting or behaving in a particular way.
A motion picture; a story or event recorded on film or video to be shown in a theater or on television.
A title used before a surname or full name to address or refer to a man without stating whether he is married.
A title used before a surname or full name to address or refer to a married woman.
A title used before a surname or full name to address or refer to a woman without indicating her marital status.
Close at hand; not far away.
In spite of that; nevertheless.
In a way that is easily perceived or understood; clearly.
Acceptable or satisfactory; used to express agreement or assent.
Same as 'Ok'; acceptable or agreed upon.
Connected to or available through the internet.
People or things that are different or remaining.
Personal computer; a computer designed for use by one person at a time.
A device used for voice communication over long distances.
Post meridiem; referring to the time from noon to midnight.
Prime Minister; the head of government in some countries.
Exactly or sharply defined or stated.
In American football, the player who directs the team's offensive play.
The transmission and reception of electromagnetic waves of radio frequency.
The exchange of goods or services for money.
In a solemn or thoughtful manner; genuinely or sincerely.
Vulgar term for feces; also used as an exclamation expressing anger or frustration.
A long, narrow piece of equipment worn on the feet to glide over snow.
To move over snow on skis.
A sport played by two teams of eleven players with a round ball that may not be touched with the hands or arms during play, except by the goalkeepers.
Programs and other operating information used by a computer.
An unspecified person.
Relating to the former Soviet Union or its government.
In a way that achieves the desired result.
Quickly and unexpectedly.
In a way that causes surprise; unexpectedly.
A person aged between 13 and 19 years old.
A system for transmitting visual images and sound that are reproduced on screens, primarily used to broadcast programs for entertainment, information, and education.
Conditions or stipulations in an agreement or contract.
The present day.
Short for television.
In a way that is characteristic or usual.
Used to express regret or disappointment about a situation.
Under normal conditions; generally.
The recording, reproducing, or broadcasting of moving visual images.
Short for 'versus', meaning 'against' in contests or comparisons.
The end of the week, typically Saturday and Sunday, when people do not work.
Things produced, especially in art or literature.
Performs a job or function.
Informal yes; used to express agreement.
